author: Steve Robson
title: Killer who stabbed, decapitated and cannibalised stranger on bus is now FREE and completely unmonitored in Canada
text:
News Killer who stabbed, decapitated and cannibalised stranger on bus is now FREE and completely unmonitored in Canada Vince Li attacked Timothy McLean at random, cut off his head and began eating parts of his flesh Share Vince Weiguang Li (Photo: Reuters) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A killer who decapitated a stranger on a bus and partially ate him is now FREE and completely unmonitored in Canada. 
Vince Li, who renamed himself Will Baker, committed one of the most gruesome killings in the country's history in 2008. 
But incredibly, he has now been set free because mental health experts say he no longer poses a threat to the public. 
His victim's mother responded by saying simply: "I have no words." Tim Mclean, 22, was attacked at random by Li and decapitated (Photo: Myspace) 
While travelling on a Greyhound bus, Li pulled out a large knife and suddenly began attacking 22-year-old Timothy Mclean. 
The bus driver pulled into the side of the road and fled along with other passengers, locking the doors. Read More 
Li, then aged 40, decapitated Mr Mclean and paraded his severed head to those watching outside. 
He then proceeded to cut off bits of the victim's flesh and eat it. 
When police arrived, they found witnesses at the side of the road in tears, many having vomitted. 
Following a stand-off with armed police which lasted until the next morning, Li tried to escape and was captured after being Tasered twice. 
Li, a Chinese national who is now aged 48, was found not criminally responsible for the crime in 2009. 
Psychiatrists said he was suffering from untreated schizophrenia at the time. The horrific attack happened on board a Greyhound bus in front of horrified passengers (file image) (Photo: BusBud) 
He spent seven years being treat in mental health facilities. 
Last year, Li was allowed to start living independently on the condition he continued to take medication and see professionals. Read More Murderer's girlfriend jailed after seducing police station colleague with sexual favours to identify protected witness 
But now CBC Canada reports he has been given a conditional discharge. 
It means he is no longer obliged to see mental health professionals and now lives freely in Winnipeg. 
His lawyer Alan Libman says he has plans to visit his family in China later in the year. 
Mr Libman told the Winnipeg Sun: "No one who has worked with him believes he's a danger to anyone, no one who has worked with him has anything negative to say. 
"He's been hard-working, compliant, and has done everything that's been asked of him." 
Mr McLean's mother, Carol de Delley, has campaigned ferociously against Li's release. 
She wrote on Facebok: "This just in....Vince Li/Will Baker was granted an absolute discharge today by the Manitoba review board. 
"I have no comment today. I have no words." Like us on Facebook
